title: title

text:
Hello,

I found that resample_to_img() and resample_img() functions do not appear to work with the latest version of Scipy 0.18.

I reverted my version of Scipy back to 0.15 which appeared to fix the problem.

Thanks,
Joe
title: resample_img functions incompatible with scipy 0.18

text:
Could you provide a snippet of code to reproduce the issue ?
Thx,

I first tried using this function to resample my nifti image:

`nilearn.image.resample_to_img(source,target)`

which gave the following warning, and the output file was empty:

> UserWarning: The behaviour of affine_transform with a one-dimensional array supplied for the matrix parameter has changed in scipy 0.18.0.

I then downgraded Scipy to version 0.15 and it worked fine.

>     UserWarning: The behaviour of affine_transform with a one-dimensional array
>     supplied for the matrix parameter has changed in scipy 0.18.0.

> I then downgraded Scipy to version 0.15 and it worked fine.

This is just a warning.

The latest nilearn are compatible with scipy 0.18.

title: title

text:
In 0.2.6, when we pass a path to a 4D Nifti image to clean_img, we  get an error msg,
```
lib/python3.5/site-packages/nilearn/image/image.py", line 861, in clean_img
    imgs_.get_data().reshape(-1, imgs.shape[-1]).T, sessions=sessions,
AttributeError: 'str' object has no attribute 'shape'
```
The reason is ```imgs``` is a path string not nii object.
This commit corrects the problem by modfiy ```imgs``` to ```imgs_```.
title: correct a bug in nilearn.image.clean_img

AttributeError: 'str' object has no attribute 'shape'

title: Pull request merge from htygithub/nilearn:master to nilearn/nilearn:master

text: That's the right fix. Thank you; merging.

correct a bug in nilearn.image.clean_img

In 0.2.6, when we pass a path to a 4D Nifti image to clean_img, we will get an error msg,
```
lib/python3.5/site-packages/nilearn/image/image.py", line 861, in clean_img
    imgs_.get_data().reshape(-1, imgs.shape[-1]).T, sessions=sessions,
AttributeError: 'str' object has no attribute 'shape'
```
This commit corrects the problem.

title: Pull request merge from ahoyosid/nilearn:solving_check_cv to nilearn/nilearn:master

text:
@KamalakerDadi @mrahim @AlexandreAbraham @lesteve
Can someone of you review this?
General comment: What is the motivation of this PR ? Is because of conflicts ?

> The cross_validation module is going to be deprecated in 0.20 not 0.18.

No: it's deprecate in 0.18, it's going to be remove in 0.20. We shouldn't
be using it.

> For the moment we can still use the check_cv in cross_validation.

No, not when 0.18 is installed. We need to make an adaption layer.

title: (None, '', u'nilearn/_utils/fixes/__init__.py')

text:
The change is simple, not importing check_cv from model_selection, as it does not receive an X param and it causes conflicts.
My bad, that comment was a personal message, I'll remove it.
title: (None, '', u'nilearn/_utils/fixes/__init__.py')

text: I don't understand. That's the wrong change: it is importing the deprecated check_cv in 0.18. We shouldn't use the sklearn.cross_validation module in sklearn > 0.18, we should use sklearn.model_selection.
title: (None, '', u'nilearn/_utils/fixes/__init__.py')

text:
Ok, my bad (again).
The cross_validation module is going to be deprecated in 0.20 not 0.18.
The check_cv in model_selection does not receive X as param, as well as the CV API. Then, we have to think about this deprecation in near future --e.g. using cross validation in Nilearn examples.
For the moment we can still use the check_cv in cross_validation.

text: Wouldn't it be a better strategy to do this copy in the loop below? Also using the tee maybe?
title: (None, '', u'nilearn/connectome/group_sparse_cov.py')

text:
Just this comment to address before the merge. To be clear, what I have in mind is something like: 
n_refinements = 3

cv = (i**2 for i in range(5))

import itertools

# Use itertools.tee to duplicate multiple times the cv iterator
for this_cv in itertools.tee(cv, n_refinements):
    print(list(this_cv))
And then you can use the cv object just as before.

title: title

text:
Sorry for disturbing you

I would like to align two MNI space images(same resolution, different affine&shape) to the same voxel space.

>image.resample_to_img(atlas,stats, 
                    interpolation='nearest', copy=True, order='F')

and raise an error：

>BoundingBoxError: The field of view given by the target affine does not contain any of the data

So can you tell me how to do this?
title: A question about 'image.resample_img'

text:
Do you think you can share/attach your nifti files ?

You error message looks like there are spurious images to me.

[atlas+stats.zip](https://github.com/nilearn/nilearn/files/644261/atlas.stats.zip)
Thank you very much

Just like this:
>>> A = image.load_img('/Volumes/LA_Fun/Allen/MRI/rs_reorder_T1_donor9861.nii')
>>> B = image.load_img('/Volumes/LA_Fun/atlas/BN_Atlas_246_1mm.nii.gz')
>>> B.shape
(182, 218, 182)
>>> A.shape
(197, 233, 189)
>>> C = image.resample_to_img(A, B)

This one '/Volumes/LA_Fun/Allen/MRI/rs_reorder_T1_donor9861.nii' doesn't seems like in MNI space.
Can you check by specifying coordinates to [0, 0, 0]. If image is in MNI space then you see cursor at AC-PC line (Please google it if you don't know what AC-PC is)

Let me know after aligning to MNI space, if it worked or not ?

Can you try this ?
```python
